timeline.bodyText: It seems to me this method is the same as CompletableFuture.allOf(...)

replies.bodyText: allOf finishes when all the futures finish, here we need to quit once one of the futures terminate exceptionally.

timeline.bodyText: This is not the fsync latency, but rather the fsync time of all dirty segments. Based on the current batch + segment size at most it the sum of fsyncing two files.
timeline.author: Maithem

timeline.bodyText: Having a histogram on the batch size/queue size can help answer questions about queuing delay.
timeline.author: Maithem

timeline.bodyText: This is a really short period given that most of the metrics collected are aggregates.
timeline.author: Maithem

replies.bodyText: This was for debugging. Increased to a minute.
replies.author: PavelZaytsev

timeline.bodyText: We need to capture stats on the window size and number of evictions per trim call.
